content:
Not everyone knows how to play roulette! Please explain what happens to his cash depending on the ball's outcome! Especially with that vicious "0 isn't even" case in the end; I'm not even sure it would actually remain visible if this problem got accepted!

You might want to go full English: PAIR->EVEN, IMPAIR/UNEVEN->ODD,  comma-separated value->fractional value, current cash he -> cash he currently, number of CASH -> amount of CASH, 

Also, for some reason your enumeration comes out as 1-2-4 instead of 1-2-3.
Thanks for the feedback! I will update it soon!

How soon is soon? :-) Sorry. Couldn't resist.

Don't bother. I have made the required updates, including:

- Added payout information since it was missing
- Changed the order of the last two tests so that there is not a new "requirement" (0 is not even) introduced in a validator. This is generally frowned on.
- Update all the tests to state EVEN and ODD
- Update your sample solution and retested with it to ensure that everything still works.

With these modifications, I have voted to accept this puzzle.

@player_one much better, thanks!

You missed some PAIR/IMPAIR translations in the constraints section.

Also, I have to say, wording as "the payout is *parity*" in a sentence that already contains the words EVEN and ODD is extremely confusing.

I'd suggest expanding one of the 35-to-1 or 1-to-1 with what happens when you win or lose on those (bet how much, win or lose how much, net change), if betting games detail aren't too much. Main reason being: ther eare no "unit" test cases: all of the behavior is hidden in long lists, so someone who isn't familiar with how betting games work (and I wish there to be many) isn't going to have a chance at understanding why it's going wrong.

PS: any clue about the 1-2-4 numbering in the input section?
All good suggestions. I finally figured out what you meant by the 1-2-4. I just kept missing it! Good catch. I don't know what was going on there. I have changed it. Look good to you now?

MUCH better. The payout details are beyond what I could dream, nice surprise :D

I haven't retested the whole thing, I don't remember where I put the code, so I'll ask here: what's the situation with the zero now?
Both the last test case and the last validator depend on that additional logic.
Wouldn't it be better to have it stated in the description instead of in validator name?
Thanks. I can see the logic of your request, and have made the update.
Hey Guys! Thanks a lot for your help! Sorry I currently dont have the time sooo ....big thx!
